sentences.en: All reptiles have to slough their skin to grow.
sentences.cn: 所有爬行动物生长过程中都要蜕皮。

sentences.en: At that time the country was in the slough of despond.
sentences.cn: 当时该国陷入深深的绝望之中.

sentences.en: Companies need to learn how to unlearn , to slough off yesterday's wisdom.
sentences.cn: 公司要学会怎样放弃,要勇于抛弃昨日的成就.

sentences.en: He saved her from the slough of despond.
sentences.cn: 他把她从绝望的深渊中拯救了出来.

sentences.en: He was not able to slough off the memories of the past.
He was sinking into the Slough of Despond.
sentences.cn: 他那时正陷入极度沮丧的状态。

sentences.en: In a prolonged course the hooves, horns and hair may slough.
sentences.cn: 在病程长的病例中,蹄壳 、 角和被毛可能脱落.

sentences.en: London - bound traffic is being diverted via Slough.
sentences.cn: 开往伦敦的车辆现绕道经过斯劳.

sentences.en: Normal glass will slough off silicon that may stimulate high levels of production.
sentences.cn: 普通玻璃可能会使刺激高水平生产量的硅脱落.

sentences.en: Our bodies slough off dead cells.
sentences.cn: 我们身体上死去的细胞会脱落。

sentences.en: She tried hard to slough off her old personality.
sentences.cn: 她努力告别从前的个性。

sentences.en: Slough occurs at the wound site.
Slough off dry skin once a week.

words.tran_cn: 脱落的；泥泞的；腐肉的；腐痂覆盖的
蜕下的皮（或壳）；绝境；[地理]泥沼；[外科]腐肉

trans.tran_cn: 泥沼, 蜕的皮, 腐肉
trans.tran_en: an area of land covered in deep dirty water or mud

trans.tran_cn: 蜕皮，脱落，在泥浆中跋涉
使陷入泥沼，长痂，生痂，抛弃
trans.tran_en: When a plant sloughs its leaves, or an animal such as a snake sloughs its skin, the leaves or skin come off naturally
